meta.title: COVID-19 District Information - Lu Verne Community School District

link.title: Lu Verne Community School District - News

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: The Governor has ordered schools closed until April 30. Classes are scheduled to resume on May 1st. We will provide more information as it becomes available. No School starting March 16th - April 30th. For more information see our COVID-19 webpage at under the Home link.

a.div: Lu Verne Elementary School (Lu Verne CSD)

div.label: Translate Page

a.div: Lu Verne Elementary School (Lu Verne CSD)

a.title: link to our district COVID-19 page.
link to our district COVID-19 page.

span.span: We are using this page to link to documents pertaining to the COVID-19 pandemic and our school district. We are also linking to the COVID-19 information page of our sharing partner Algona CSD. This document will be updated as needed. You can also see the latest information from our district on our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Corwith-Wesley-Lu-Verne-CSD-430165613764803/

span.p: * Governor Reynolds has extended cancelled classes until April 30, 2020. Algona and Lu Verne CSD will be doing voluntary enrichment for our students during this time. Here is a link to the letter we are sending out to our parents on April 3, 2020. District COVID Letter - April 3

span.span: *The main office will be open from 10:00 am- 2:00 pm daily (as of March 19). We would suggest before you come to call to make sure we are in the office. If you need to come to the building we ask that you please use hand sanitizer or wash your hands in our restroom before coming to the office. If you are not feeling well or running a fever we ask that you do not come into the building.
*We would like to thank Greg and Ally for working to thoroughly clean our building during this outbreak. We will also be cleaning our outside playground equipment.
* To sign up for our delivered lunch program, please go to the following link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSesKKLrz1FaLVD3uIm9dDj4s5QaB28jjNzIezaJo5yQcwlT5Q/viewform

We will be providing meals to our families ans students on Monday, Wed and Friday. We will be delivering 2 breakfast and 2 lunches for each person. This can include adults in the household. These meals are being offered free of charge to our families. We will deliver these meals around the noon hour and this would also include families who live in our rural areas.

* Here is information if you would get sick with COVID-19 from the CDC: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/steps-when-sick.html?fbclid=IwAR3bZgSNaR5PteVofpWp-8lEdo0-wuFmyTe7cMtLA3siWym4OoxSsgbbg5I

*If you currently have been receiving backpack buddies from our school and are in need or could use some more supplies, please contact the school office at 515-882-3357 and we will take the message and find a way to get these delivered to you.

*If your child has left something at school that is needed, please contact our office at 515-882-3357 and we will see about getting that item for you. We then can work out a time for you to pick it up. Remember this would be for something that absolutely need the next four weeks.

*We will be posting activities that you can do with your child or sites that will help keep your child's mind sharp during this break. Check back often for that page. The best thing you can do with your child is to have them read 20 minutes a day or you read to them 20 minutes a day.
Click on the link below to our engagement page. This will be updated on a regular basis by our staff, so stop back often.
Here is a link to video's of our teacher's reading books to our students!

div.div:
This is a secure Staff Intranet content page and cannot be viewed by the public. Please contact your Technology Director to gain access to the Staff Intranet area in order to view this page.
Thank you,

p.span: It is the policy of the Lu Verne Community School District not to illegally discriminate on the basis of age (for employment), race, creed, national origin, color, marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, religion, gender/sex, socio-economic status (for programs), gender identity or physical/mental disability in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the district’s Equity Coordinator, Tom Fey, Asst Admin, 405 Hanna Ave, Lu Verne, IA 50560, 515-882-3357, tfey@luverne.k12.ia.us
